basics.name: Ebrahim Hamidi
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate
basics.summary: I am a dedicated researcher focused on compound coastal flood hazard assessment using the integration of remote sensing data, geospatial analysis, and numerical simulations. My expertise lies in leveraging high-performance and cloud computing platforms to develop innovative solutions for natural hazard assessment and disaster response.

work.name: Coastal Hydrology Lab
work.summary: Conducting advanced research on multi-hazard risk analysis of coastal compound flooding, with emphasis on integrating data and models for improved prediction and response.
highlights: Developed hybrid approaches combining hydrodynamic simulations and remote sensing data for flood extent mapping.
Implemented cloud-based computing solutions to process large-scale datasets, enhancing computational efficiency.
Collaborated with NSF and USACE on high-impact research projects addressing coastal flood risks.

work.name: National Water Center Program Summer Institute
work.summary: Planned and organized the Summer Institute, collaborating with leaders and fellows to facilitate impactful research.
highlights: Supervised research teams working on coastal flood modeling.
Assisted fellows with technical challenges and presentations.
Developed training materials on geospatial data processing and analysis.

work.name: National Water Center Program Summer Institute
work.summary: Developing a coastal-inland coupled BMI for Next Gen National Water Model
highlights: Collaborate with our research team and coastal-coupling theme leads.
Preparing weekly research progress presentation and final report.
Development on Next-Generation National Water Model.

work.name: Pars Padab Sanaat Consulting Engineers Company
work.summary: Led engineering projects and design of municipal and industrial structures, including hydraulic structures and flood control systems.
highlights: Designed complex hydraulic systems for urban flood management.
Conducted site assessments and feasibility studies for industrial structures.
Supervised multidisciplinary teams on large-scale engineering projects.
